briefdescription.para: Enumeration for the known authentication commands.
This function appends an initial client response to the given string.
This function processes a block of data received from the peer.

memberdef.definition: typedef dbus_bool_t(* DBusAuthEncodeFunction) (DBusAuth *auth, const DBusString *data, DBusString *encoded)
memberdef.name: DBusAuthEncodeFunction

briefdescription.para: This function encodes a block of data from the peer.

memberdef.definition: typedef dbus_bool_t(* DBusAuthDecodeFunction) (DBusAuth *auth, const DBusString *data, DBusString *decoded)
memberdef.name: DBusAuthDecodeFunction

briefdescription.para: This function decodes a block of data from the peer.
This function is called when the mechanism is abandoned.

memberdef.definition: typedef dbus_bool_t(* DBusAuthStateFunction) (DBusAuth *auth, DBusAuthCommand command, const DBusString *args)
memberdef.name: DBusAuthStateFunction

briefdescription.para: Auth state function, determines the reaction to incoming events for a particular state.

detaileddescription.para: Returns whether we had enough memory to complete the operation.

memberdef.name: all_mechanisms
memberdef.initializer: = { { "EXTERNAL", handle_server_data_external_mech, NULL, NULL, handle_server_shutdown_external_mech, handle_client_initial_response_external_mech, handle_client_data_external_mech, NULL, NULL, handle_client_shutdown_external_mech }, { "DBUS_COOKIE_SHA1", handle_server_data_cookie_sha1_mech, NULL, NULL, handle_server_shutdown_cookie_sha1_mech, handle_client_initial_response_cookie_sha1_mech, handle_client_data_cookie_sha1_mech, NULL, NULL, handle_client_shutdown_cookie_sha1_mech }, { "ANONYMOUS", handle_server_data_anonymous_mech, NULL, NULL, handle_server_shutdown_anonymous_mech, handle_client_initial_response_anonymous_mech, handle_client_data_anonymous_mech, NULL, NULL, handle_client_shutdown_anonymous_mech }, { NULL, NULL } }

memberdef.name: auth_command_names
memberdef.initializer: = { { "AUTH", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_AUTH }, { "CANCEL", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_CANCEL }, { "DATA", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_DATA }, { "BEGIN", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_BEGIN }, { "REJECTED", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_REJECTED }, { "OK", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_OK }, { "ERROR", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_ERROR }, { "NEGOTIATE_UNIX_FD", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_NEGOTIATE_UNIX_FD }, { "AGREE_UNIX_FD", DBUS_AUTH_COMMAND_AGREE_UNIX_FD } }

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusAuth *auth, int cookie_id, const DBusString *server_challenge, const DBusString *client_challenge, DBusString *hash)
memberdef.name: sha1_compute_hash

simplesect.para: TRUE if the conversation is the server side
TRUE if the conversation is the client side

briefdescription.para: The name of the auth ("client" or "server")
http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2831.txt suggests at least 64 bits of entropy, we use 128.

detaileddescription.para: This is the number of bytes in the random challenge.
